title: EPIC: Noia Memory Layer
Test memory-lancedb auto-capture
Test memory-lancedb auto-recall
Verify OpenAI embeddings working
Document memory-lancedb behavior
Add embeddings to MEMORY.md
Add embeddings to daily/*.md files
Add embeddings to projects/*.md files
Build memory.recall() wrapper tool
Test semantic search accuracy
Design facts.jsonl schema
Implement fact extraction from conversations
Add valid_at/invalid_at timestamps to facts
Build fact invalidation logic
Create timeline query function
Design Noia Memory MCP interface
Implement memory.init() MCP tool
Implement memory.recall() MCP tool
Implement memory.capture() MCP tool
Implement memory.edit() MCP tool
Implement memory.timeline() MCP tool
Test MCP with Claude Desktop
Design self-editing memory rules
Implement memory block auto-update
A/B test self-edit vs manual
Document Noia Memory architecture
EPIC: Noia Memory Layer v2 — Local Vector DB + Markdown
Choose & install local vector DB (ChromaDB vs SQLite-vec vs LanceDB)
description: Evaluate: ChromaDB (Python, mature), SQLite-vec (lightweight, no deps), LanceDB (Rust, fast). Pick one. Install it. Verify it runs locally.

title: Build auto-indexer: watch markdown files → embed on change
description: Background process that watches ~/clawd/memory/, MEMORY.md, etc. On file change, chunk and embed into vector DB. Must handle incremental updates, not full re-index.

title: Build semantic search CLI tool
description: CLI that takes a query string, searches vector DB, returns top-N results with file path + line numbers + relevance score. Must be <50ms for local queries.

title: Integrate vector search into Clawdbot memory_search
description: Replace or augment current memory_search with vector DB results. Seamless — I should just get better results without changing how I call it.

title: Design structured index schema for people/decisions/projects
description: Define how to tag and link entities across memory files. People, decisions, projects, lessons, dates. Must be queryable without a database — markdown + frontmatter or JSONL sidecar.

title: Build auto-capture: extract facts from conversations
description: After conversations, automatically extract key facts, decisions, preferences, and store them in structured format. Not just raw logs — distilled knowledge.

title: Build timeline query: what happened on/around date X
description: Given a date or date range, return all relevant memories, decisions, events. Combines vector search with date filtering.

title: Document the architecture
description: Write up how the whole system works. Architecture diagram. How to maintain, backup, migrate. Future-you and future-Kevin need to understand this.

title: EPIC: Noia Console v2 — Personal AI Command Center
description: Master plan: 7 phases from foundation to mobile/migration. Goal: Kevin's daily interface to his AI life.

title: WebSocket real-time connection to Clawdbot Gateway
description: Connect to Gateway WS. Live events: chat, agent status, presence. Auto-reconnect. Connection indicator.

title: Chat view: real-time streaming + multi-session
description: Streaming responses, session switcher, spawn new conversations, markdown rendering, typing indicators.

title: Auth & config management
description: Token storage, Gateway URL config (for Mac Mini migration), user profile from USER.md.

title: GitHub repos dashboard view
description: List all repos (gh CLI), last commit, open PRs/issues, CI status, repo health. Quick actions.

title: Task board per repo (GitHub Issues + Beads)
description: Kanban/list of issues per repo. Create/edit/close from console. Cross-repo view. Beads integration.

title: Repo scanner: auto-discover local projects
description: Scan ~/Desktop/hyperscale-dev/ and ~/Desktop/ADAPTAPHORIA/. Git status, stack detection, README preview.

title: Agent launcher: spin up sub-agents on repos
description: 'Work on this repo' button → spawns sub-agent. Task input + repo selection. Templates. Cost estimate.

title: Agent dashboard: live status of running agents
description: Running agents list. Per-agent: status, task, runtime, tokens. Log streaming. Abort controls.

title: Agent mail: inbox/threading per agent
description: Dedicated inbox per agent session. Updates/questions posted to thread. Reply mid-task. History.

title: Unified channel inbox (WhatsApp + iMessage + Telegram)
description: All messages in one timeline. Contact resolver. Quick reply. Unread badges.

title: Memory search UI with semantic results
description: Search bar → memory_search + noia-memory vector search. Results with scores, paths, preview. Expand context.

title: Memory timeline + calendar heatmap
description: Visual timeline of daily logs. Calendar heatmap. Drill into any day. 'On this day' feature.

title: Knowledge graph viewer (entities + relations)
description: D3.js visual graph of people, projects, decisions. Click entity → see all related memories.

title: Daily briefing + proactive notifications
description: Morning summary (calendar, tasks, messages). Smart notifications. Proactive suggestions from memory.

title: Mobile-optimized responsive UI + PWA
description: Responsive design for phone. PWA with home screen. Touch-friendly.

title: Mac Mini migration: Docker + Tailscale + PM2
description: Deployment config for Mac Mini. Tailscale secure access. Split Gateway/Console. Health monitoring.

title: BUG: MCP capture stores 'fact' field but queryFacts expects 'content'
BUG: package.json main points to nonexistent index.js, missing type:module
description: package.json has main:index.js but all files are .mjs. Also missing "type":"module" which means Node won't treat .mjs imports correctly in all contexts. Fix: set main to cli.mjs and add type:module.

title: BUG: Cost estimate uses OpenAI pricing, not Gemini
description: index.mjs line 107 calculates cost using text-embedding-3-small pricing ($0.00002/1K tokens) but we use Gemini free tier. Should show $0.00 or 'free'.

title: DB connection leak risk in watch.mjs on embed failure
description: watch.mjs indexFile() opens DB, then if embedBatch throws, db.close() is called in the catch path — but if an error occurs between openDb and the try block (e.g., during chunkMarkdown or deleteFileChunks), the connection leaks. Should use try/finally pattern.

title: Hardcoded HOME paths — not portable
description: 9 files hardcode resolve(process.env.HOME, 'clawd/...') for DB path, memory dir, and facts path. Should centralize in a single config.mjs that resolves paths once. Makes testing and future multi-user support easier.

title: No error handling for Gemini API rate limits or network failures
description: embed.mjs uses Promise.all with concurrency=5 but has no retry logic. If Gemini returns 429 (rate limit) or network drops, the entire batch fails. Should add exponential backoff retry (3 attempts) and individual chunk error isolation.

title: Zod is implicit dependency (transitive from MCP SDK)
description: mcp-server.mjs imports zod directly but it's not in package.json — only available as transitive dep from @modelcontextprotocol/sdk. Should add zod to direct dependencies for stability.

title: No tests — zero test coverage
description: package.json test script is a placeholder echo. No unit tests for chunker, search, capture, entities, or recall. At minimum need tests for: chunker edge cases (empty files, huge sections), capture pattern matching, recall integration, fact query null safety.

title: Entity extractor has narrow hardcoded patterns
description: entities.mjs KNOWN_PEOPLE only has Kevin and Noia. Person detection relies on possessive patterns (Name's business) which misses most people mentions. Decision/preference/lesson patterns are regex-only — will miss many valid entries. Consider LLM-assisted extraction as optional enhancement, or expand patterns significantly.

title: noia-mem CLI not on PATH (symlink missing)
description: TOOLS.md says noia-mem is at ~/bin/noia-mem but the symlink doesn't exist. 'noia-mem stats' returns command not found. Need: ln -s ~/clawd/noia-memory/cli.mjs ~/bin/noia-mem

title: Duplicate glob patterns in indexer find redundant files
description: index.mjs patterns include both 'memory/**/*.md' AND 'memory/daily/*.md' + 'memory/projects/*.md'. The ** pattern already covers daily/ and projects/. The dedup in glob() handles it but it's confusing and does wasted work.

title: MCP server lacks memory.edit() and memory.init() tools
description: mcp-server.mjs has 6 tools but is missing memory.edit() (modify existing facts/memories) and memory.init() (bootstrap a fresh DB). These are tracked as separate tasks (noia-cy3 and noia-72i) but should be noted as incomplete in the MCP interface.

title: Research: Evaluate PageIndex vectorless RAG vs noia-memory side-by-side
description: PageIndex (github.com/VectifyAI/PageIndex) — vectorless, reasoning-based RAG using hierarchical tree index instead of vector embeddings. 10.4k stars, trending Jan 2026. 98.7% accuracy on FinanceBench. Has MCP integration. Different approach than our Gemini embeddings + sqlite-vec. Could be complementary for long structured documents (contracts, regulatory docs). Test both approaches on same queries to compare accuracy/speed/cost. Blog: pageindex.ai/blog/pageindex-intro

title: EPIC: PageIndex — Document Analysis Skill
Research & scaffold PageIndex Clawdbot skill
description: Create skill folder structure (SKILL.md, scripts), evaluate whether to wrap the Python PageIndex library or build a lighter CLI. Decide on OpenAI vs multi-provider LLM support. Output: skill scaffold with SKILL.md ready.

title: Build pageindex CLI wrapper
description: CLI tool that wraps PageIndex for indexing PDFs/docs into tree indexes and querying them. Commands: pageindex index <file>, pageindex query <file> <question>, pageindex list (show indexed docs). Store trees in ~/.pageindex/ or similar.

title: Integrate PageIndex as Clawdbot skill
description: Wire up SKILL.md so Noia can use pageindex for document review. Handle file upload flow (user sends PDF via WhatsApp/chat → save → index → ready for queries). Register in available_skills.

title: PDF upload + indexing pipeline
description: Handle receiving documents from chat channels, saving them, auto-indexing with PageIndex, and confirming readiness. Support re-indexing and listing indexed documents.

title: Multi-document cross-search for PageIndex
description: Enable querying across multiple indexed documents. Aggregate tree search results from multiple PageIndex trees to answer questions spanning several docs.

title: PageIndex cost controls & model config
description: Configurable LLM provider (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic). Cost estimation before indexing. Budget limits. Model selection per operation (cheaper model for summaries, better model for tree search).

title: EPIC: AI Workforce Platform — Autonomous AI Team Operating System
Decide project name / codename
description: Pick a name for the AI workforce platform project. Something that captures the vision — autonomous AI teams running companies.

title: Architecture diagram — brain, skin, orchestration
description: Draw the full system architecture: Identity System, Orchestration Engine, Execution Layer, LLM Router, Frontend Skin. Define how components communicate. This is the most important design doc.

title: Tech stack decision — language, DB, hosting
description: Decide: Python vs TypeScript vs Go for backend. Postgres vs SQLite for DB. Vector DB for memory (pgvector? chromadb?). Hosting: Digital Ocean droplet (already have one). Frontend: Next.js? Considerations: Kevin codes in Go, AI ecosystem is Python, full-stack consistency is TypeScript.

title: Define persona schema — identity, memory, capabilities
description: Design the data model for a persona: name, role, personality profile, expertise areas, system prompt template, memory store, conversation history, tool/API permissions, avatar, display name. This is the core entity of the entire platform.

title: Build persona identity service — CRUD for personas
description: API/service to create, read, update, delete personas. Store in DB. Each persona: name, role, personality, system prompt, avatar URL, expertise tags, assigned channels, tool permissions.

title: Persona memory system — persistent per-persona memory
description:
Each persona needs persistent memory that survives restarts.

ALREADY BUILT (reusable from noia-mem):
- sqlite-vec + better-sqlite3 vector DB (~/clawd/noia-memory/)
- Gemini embeddings (3072 dimensions, free tier)
- Semantic search across markdown files
- Entity and relation extraction
- Facts extraction (facts.jsonl)
- Timeline queries
- CLI: noia-mem index/search/extract/entities/relations/capture/facts/timeline

NEEDS ADAPTATION:
- Multi-persona namespacing (each persona gets own memory space)
- Shared company memory layer (brand docs, decisions accessible to all)
- Auto-consolidation (cron-driven reflection: compress convos into facts)
- Task checkpointing (save work-in-progress to disk, resume after compaction)
- Three-tier memory: working (context window) → short-term (session summaries) → long-term (vector DB + facts)
- Memory recall at response time: semantic search relevant context before generating

ARCHITECTURE DECISION (2026-01-28):
Hybrid approach — file-first transparency + vector search + temporal facts.
See: memory/projects/noia-memory.md

title: Conversation history persistence — DB-backed
description: Replace in-memory channel_history dict with DB-backed storage. Store all conversations per channel, per persona, per DM. Enable context window management — load recent + semantically relevant history.

title: Company/tenant data model — multi-tenant foundation
description: Design multi-tenant data model. A Company has: name, brand context, personas, channels, execution configs, memory store. Adaptaphoria = company 1, HelloSpore = company 2. Shared infra, isolated data.

title: Create 7 Discord bot accounts for core team personas
description: Create Discord developer applications for: Jessica Park (moderator), Marcus Chen (sales), Patricia Walsh (distribution), Sofia Martinez (CMO), Robert Sterling (CFO), Harold Whitfield (legal), Dr. Karen Liu (R&D). Upload avatars, set display names, invite to GCB Command server.

title: Multi-bot connection manager — one process, 7+ bot connections
description: Refactor gcb-persona-bot.py to manage multiple Discord bot connections from one process. Each persona connects with their own token. Messages route to the right persona's LLM context. Enables real DMs, real member list presence, real @mentions between personas.

title: DM support — direct message individual personas
description: With individual bot accounts, users can DM any persona directly. Each DM gets its own conversation thread with persistent memory. Sofia remembers your last marketing discussion. Marcus remembers your last sales call.

title: Cross-persona conversation engine
description: When one persona posts, the orchestration engine decides if other personas should respond. Rules: if Marcus posts a sales update, Sofia might comment on marketing angle, Harold flags regulatory concerns. Configurable triggers. Avoid infinite loops (max 3 responses per thread). Add natural delays between responses.

title: Cron-driven persona autonomy — proactive behavior
description: Personas should act on their own. Jessica runs Monday morning standups. Marcus reviews pipeline weekly. Sofia plans content calendar. Robert flags financial milestones. Harold monitors regulatory news. Each persona has a cron schedule of proactive tasks. Posts results to relevant channels.

title: LLM router — per-persona model selection and cost optimization
description: Different personas may need different models. Quick responses: Gemini Flash. Deep analysis: Claude Sonnet. Creative work: Claude Opus. Build a router that selects model based on persona config + task complexity. Track costs per persona per company.

title: Execution layer framework — tool/API abstraction
description: Build the framework for personas to execute real-world actions. Each action type is a plugin: Shopify, Instagram, email, file write, blog publish. Personas declare intent, framework handles auth, rate limits, error handling. All executions logged.

title: Approval flow system — human-in-the-loop
description: Any persona action that modifies the real world requires human approval. Flow: persona proposes action → notification to orchestrator (Kevin) → approve/edit/reject → execute or cancel. DM-based approval in Discord. Queue dashboard in future web UI. Configurable: some actions auto-approve (read-only), some always need approval (publish, spend money).

title: Shopify execution plugin — edit products, themes, orders
description: First execution plugin. Personas can: view products, edit descriptions/prices, update inventory, edit theme sections, view orders. All changes go through approval flow.

title: Social media execution plugin — Instagram, YouTube, blog
description: Personas can: draft social posts, schedule content, publish blog articles, create content calendars. Sofia (CMO) is the primary user. All posts go through approval flow. Start with Instagram + blog, add YouTube/TikTok later.

title: File and document access — read/write business files
description: Personas can read business documents from the company workspace (brand guides, research reports, financials). Write access for generating docs, reports, briefs. File changes go through approval flow.

title: Multi-tenant support — multiple companies on one platform
description: Add Adaptaphoria as tenant 1, HelloSpore as tenant 2. Isolated data, shared infra. Company switcher. Each company has its own personas, channels, memory, execution configs. Same platform, different teams.

title: Persona template system — easy creation of new team members
description: Templates for common roles: CMO, CFO, Sales Director, etc. Create a new persona in minutes. Auto-generate system prompt from role + company context. Avatar generation. Skill/tool assignment based on role.

title: Custom web UI — Phase 2 frontend
description:
React/Next.js web application for the platform.

ALREADY BUILT (reusable from Noia Console):
- React + Vite + Tailwind CSS 4 + Framer Motion
- Chat view with streaming responses
- Sessions API integration
- Memory search UI (placeholder)
- Agent viewer
- GitHub integration + task board
- WebSocket connection to Clawdbot Gateway
- 7 views built total
- Repo: github.com/kkeeland/noia-console

NEEDS ADAPTATION:
- Multi-persona chat (DM each persona individually)
- Channel view (team discussions)
- Approval queue dashboard
- Execution status (live view of persona actions)
- Company switcher (Adaptaphoria ↔ HelloSpore)
- Persona management (create/edit team members)
- Disconnect from Clawdbot Gateway, connect to platform backend API

title: Mobile app — push notifications for approvals
description: Phase 3: Mobile app for the orchestrator. Push notifications when personas need approval. Voice messages to team members. Quick approve/reject from phone. Not needed until web UI is stable.

title: Adapt noia-mem for multi-persona memory namespaces
description: Fork/extend noia-mem (~/clawd/noia-memory/) to support multiple persona memory spaces. Each persona gets their own vector index + facts store. Add shared company memory layer accessible to all personas. Keep the sqlite-vec + Gemini embeddings stack.

title: Auto-consolidation — cron-driven memory reflection
description: After each conversation or on a schedule, personas consolidate their working memory into structured long-term facts. Extract: decisions made, action items, key insights, relationship updates. Store in vector DB + facts.jsonl per persona. Like sleeping — consolidate the day's learning.

title: Task checkpointing — survive context window compaction
description: When a persona is working on a multi-step task, periodically write task state to disk: what's done, what's next, current findings. If the context window compacts or the session resets, the persona reads the checkpoint and continues. No lost work.

title: Memory recall at response time — semantic context injection
description: Before generating any response, the persona searches their long-term memory for relevant context. Query: user's message + channel topic + recent conversation. Inject top-K relevant memories into the system prompt. This is how personas remember without stuffing the context window.

title: Refactor cli.mjs — extract command registry pattern
description: cli.mjs is 553 lines doing routing, formatting, and arg parsing. Extract a command registry pattern so each command is a self-contained module. This will scale as more commands are added.

title: Fix DB connection management — singleton + guaranteed close
description: Several modules open DB without guaranteed close. watch.mjs can leak handles if embedBatch throws. Implement: 1) try/finally in all DB-opening code, 2) singleton pattern for the watcher daemon, 3) graceful shutdown cleanup.

title: Cache prepared statements in db.mjs
description: db.prepare() is called on every operation — same SQL compiled 87+ times during batch indexing. Cache prepared statements (lazy init or module-level Map) so each SQL string is compiled once per DB connection.

title: Split memory-promote.mjs into focused modules
description: 739 lines doing fact analysis, promotion logic, file editing, backup management, and plan formatting. Split into: analyze.mjs (fact scoring), promote.mjs (file edits), backup.mjs (backup/restore). Each under 250 lines.

title: Implement full SELF-EDIT-RULES — temporal decay + consolidation gap
description: SELF-EDIT-RULES.md describes temporal decay, contradiction detection, and consolidation. auto-update.mjs has the skeleton but contradiction detection is heuristic-only regex. Close the gap: 1) Wire temporal decay into a cron/heartbeat cycle, 2) Improve contradiction detection with embedding similarity (not just keyword overlap), 3) Actually run consolidation on schedule.

title: Add adaptive rate limiting to embedBatch
description: embedBatch concurrency is hardcoded at 5. Add: 1) Backpressure — reduce concurrency on 429s, 2) Adaptive throttle — ramp up when healthy, slow down on errors, 3) Optional concurrency param for callers.

title: EPIC: Team of Rivals — Stage-Gated Orchestration for Forge
description: Implement the Team of Rivals pattern from arXiv:2601.14351 into Forge. Specialized agent teams with opposing incentives, veto authority, stage-gated workflows, Context Ray Tracing, and brain/hands separation. Academic validation: 90%+ error interception, 38.6% cost overhead on 522 production sessions.

title: Add persona role types: planner, executor, critic with veto config
description: Extend persona schema with role_type field (planner|executor|critic|hybrid). Critics get veto_authority boolean and veto_domains (e.g. 'legal', 'financial', 'scientific'). Update Postgres schema, TypeScript types, CRUD API. Seed existing personas: Sofia/Marcus=planner, Jessica/Patricia=executor, Harold/Robert/Karen=critic.

title: Build stage-gated workflow engine: Plan → Execute → Critique → Approve
description: Core orchestration pipeline. Each task goes through stages: 1) Planner persona creates plan with acceptance criteria, 2) Executor persona does the work, 3) Critic persona(s) review against criteria — can APPROVE or VETO, 4) If vetoed, retry with critic feedback (max 3 retries), 5) If approved, deliver to user/channel. Workflow state persisted in Postgres. New table: workflows (id, task, stage, plan, output, critiques, status, retries).

title: Pre-declared acceptance criteria system (test-driven AI)
description: Before any workflow starts, the planner must declare acceptance criteria. Structured format: list of assertions that the output must satisfy. Critics evaluate against these criteria, not vibes. Criteria types: factual accuracy, format compliance, brand voice match, legal safety, financial bounds. Stored in workflow record.

title: Context Ray Tracing — selective info sharing between personas
description: Not every persona sees everything. Implement visibility rules: when a workflow involves multiple personas, each gets only the context relevant to their domain. Sofia sees marketing data, Robert sees financials, Harold sees legal implications — from the same task. Build a context_filter function per persona based on their expertise_areas and role_type. Summaries are generated for cross-domain sharing, not raw data.

title: Implement critic veto authority with structured feedback and retry
description: Critics can reject work with structured feedback: what failed, which criteria, specific issues. Rejected work goes back to executor with critic notes attached. Max 3 retries per stage. If still failing after 3, escalate to human (Kevin via approval queue). Track veto history for each workflow. Analytics: which critics veto most, common failure patterns.

title: Brain/Hands separation — personas reason, plugins execute, summaries return
description: Enforce clean separation: persona agents never touch raw API responses or full datasets. Execution plugins return structured summaries. E.g., Shopify plugin returns '42 products, 3 out of stock, revenue 2.4k this week' not the full product JSON. Persona reasons about the summary. Prevents context window contamination. Add summary_format config to each execution plugin.

title: Configure opposing incentives per persona — push/pull dynamics
description: Each persona gets an incentive_profile in their config: what they push FOR and what they push AGAINST. Sofia pushes for bold creative, pushes against playing safe. Robert pushes for fiscal discipline, pushes against overspending. Harold pushes for legal safety, pushes against regulatory risk. These incentives are injected into system prompts and shape how personas evaluate each other's work. The intersection of all opposing forces = coherent output.

title: Integrate Vercel AI SDK as LLM Router foundation
description: Replace direct provider SDK calls with Vercel AI SDK (ai package). Unified interface for Claude, Gemini, GPT. Streaming, tool calling, fallback chains all standardized. Per-persona model config already in schema — wire it through AI SDK. Add cost tracking middleware. This is the LLM Router component solved by adoption not invention.

title: Integrate pgvector-node for Memory Layer vector operations
description: Install pgvector-node (official bindings). Port noia-mem embedding logic: Gemini text-embedding-004, 3072 dims. Functions: embedText(), storeChunk(), semanticSearch(). Per-persona namespacing via persona_id + company_id. Build on existing memory_chunks table. Replace raw SQL vector queries with pgvector-node helpers.

title: test
EPIC: Bagtek Launch — Mushroom Supply Company
Phase 1: Substrate/spawn bags — product listing & pricing
Phase 1: Fulfillment & shipping setup
Phase 1: Website audit — remove disease claims
Research: Testing labs + pricing for supplements
Research: Competitor label teardown (5 brands)
Compliance: cGMP SOP template drafting
Compliance: State-level regulatory research
Insurance: Product liability quotes
EPIC: Forge Inner Council — Multi-Business Orchestration Layer
Decision Queue system — human blocker tracking with status, deadlines, recommendations
Cascade trigger engine — Expert→CEO→Human approval flow with parallel spawn
Agent output routing — findings/directives auto-save to structured paths per tenant/business
Bottleneck detector — auto-identify stalled tasks, aging decisions, blocked agents
Agent spawn manager — parallel execution with resource limits and priority queues
Agent result aggregation — collect findings from N agents into unified briefing
Agent heartbeat/health — detect hung agents, timeout handling, retry logic
Cross-business insight detection — flag when findings in one business affect another
Decision impact tracking — when Kevin decides, auto-update all affected agents/tasks
Revenue dashboard — auto-pull metrics across businesses, flag concentration risk
Competitive radar — scheduled market/competitor scans per business with change detection
Brief me command — real-time oral/text summary of all business status in 60 seconds
Decision queue notifications — ping Kevin when new decisions land, with urgency ranking
One-tap approvals — Kevin can approve/reject decisions inline without context switching
Multi-tenant Inner Council — same cascade system, different businesses/users
Custom agent templates — let users define their own expert/CEO agent roles per business
Forge onboarding flow — new user adds a business, agents auto-configure
Build remaining 6 Forge agent templates (SEO, Content Writer, Data Analyst, DevOps, QA, Security Auditor)

title: EPIC: Adaptaphoria All-In Plan — Sampler + Retail + Non-THC + PR
Build $9.99 sampler product on Shopify (4-pack)
Build sampler landing page with quiz flow
Build Klaviyo 5-email drip sequence for sampler buyers
Create Meta quiz ad creative + targeting for sampler
COA audit — pull THC levels for all Adaptaphoria SKUs
Build press kit + media one-pager (adaptogen differentiation)
Build retail sell sheet + brand deck with pricing
Ship samples to 15 publications (Leafly, Food & Wine, BevNET, etc.)
Join U.S. Hemp Roundtable ($500-$2500)
HEMP Act bill analysis — passage probability + key dates
Contact Blue Ridge Spirits for distribution partnership
Apply to UNFI vendor program
Apply to KeHE vendor program
Identify Texas regional DSD distributor
Sign coalition letters supporting HR 7024 / HEMP Act
Legal review — 0.4mg micro-dose compliance option
Competitive matrix — Adaptaphoria vs BRĒZ, Cann, Wynk, Happi
Hire TX sales rep (part-time, $3-5K/mo)
Book BevNET Live booth (June) — $5-8K
Non-THC formula finalization (ENERGIZE + UNWIND Original)
Non-THC packaging design — 4 SKUs
Non-THC test production run
Non-THC Shopify + sampler funnel launch
Amazon launch for non-THC line
Budget approval for All-In Plan ($60K-$106K)
Non-THC product name decision (Original vs Zero)
Social media + influencer seeding program (50 micro-influencers)
Cam op-ed on federal ban — pitch Forbes/Fast Company
Oregon congressional delegation outreach for HEMP Act
Bagtek website Sprint 1 — Homepage + Design System + Global Layout
Bagtek website Sprint 2 — Product Page + Cart + Checkout
Bagtek website Sprint 3 — Content pages + Blog + FAQ + Legal
Bagtek website Sprint 4 — SEO, Analytics + Launch Prep
Create Bagtek product in WooCommerce with all meta fields
FDA facility registration (when selling supplements)
Regulatory consultant — one-time compliance audit ($2-5K)
B2B outreach to mushroom grower communities for substrate bags
Merge staging SEO fixes to main (sitemap, robots, metadata)
Write + publish Chinese Peptides Gray-Market Safety article
Write + publish Oral Wegovy GLP-1 Pill Explainer article
Write + publish Compounded Semaglutide Ban Explainer article
Content audit of all 50 peptide profiles (reading level, citations, SEO)
Reading level rewrites of top 10 peptide profiles (7th grade target)
Remove placeholder vendor directory data — replace with coming soon
Fix double-fetch pattern in PeptideProfile and Article components
Write BPC-157 Human Trials article
Write Peptide Stacks Guide article
Write + publish 'Does Your AI Have a Soul?' article
Distribution: Twitter/X thread + LinkedIn post for AI Soul article
Distribution: Reddit r/philosophy + r/artificial posts
Write 'Burnout Is Not a Bug. It Is a Signal.' article
Write 'The Scroll Is the Teacher' article
Write 'The Attention Economy Is a Lie' article
Write 'Mindfulness Makes You Dangerous' article
Write 'Your Brain Is Not a Computer' article
Provision Notion API key on noia-main server
SEO audit of hellospore.com (full report with prioritized fixes)
Pull content drafts from Kevin Mac to server (Reddit posts, calendar)
Launch Reddit presence on r/sporetraders
Start WordPress blog on hellospore.com (2 posts/week)
Fix homepage title tag — remove keyword stuffing
Add meta description to hellospore.com homepage
Update memory/projects/hellospore.md with full project context
Peptok: Fix vendors page RLS — add /api/vendors route like /api/articles
Peptok: Build real vendor directory — research legit peptide vendors, clinics, testing labs
Peptok: Vendor review/rating system — user reviews, verification badges, HPLC test results
Peptok: Update OG image for Telegram/social sharing
Peptok: Fix dead internal links in articles — wrong URL patterns + missing articles
description:
Articles have internal links pointing to 404s. Two categories:

1. WRONG URL PATTERN (fixable now):
   - /peptides/bpc-157 → should be /peptide/bpc-157 (singular, uses [id] route)
   - /peptides/semaglutide → /peptide/semaglutide
   - /peptides/tb-500 → /peptide/tb-500
   - /article/slug (some use singular correctly, keep those)

2. LINKS TO NON-EXISTENT ARTICLES (need content):
   - /articles/are-peptides-legal (referenced 2x)
   - /articles/peptide-telemedicine-guide (referenced 3x)  
   - /articles/how-to-read-peptide-coa (referenced 3x)
   - /articles/compounded-semaglutide-ban-2026 (referenced 2x)

3. LINKS TO NON-EXISTENT GUIDE PAGES:
   - /guides/weight-loss-peptides
   - /guides/recovery-healing-peptides
   - /guides/anti-aging-peptides
   - /guides/performance-peptides
   - /guides/cognitive-peptides
   - /guides/peptide-safety-sourcing

FIX PLAN: 
A) Fix URL patterns in DB content (peptides→peptide)
B) Either write the missing articles or remove/update the links
C) Either create /guides/* pages or redirect to relevant articles

Affected articles: complete-guide-to-peptides (worst — 18 internal links), peptide-vendors-closing-2026, chinese-peptides-safety-guide, oral-wegovy-vs-injectable

title: Peptok: Write article — Are Peptides Legal? Complete Guide
description: Slug: are-peptides-legal. Referenced in complete-guide-to-peptides (2x). Cover FDA status, research chemical legality, state laws, prescription vs research, import rules. 2000+ words, 7th grade reading level.

title: Peptok: Write article — Peptide Telemedicine Guide
description: Slug: peptide-telemedicine-guide. Referenced in peptide-vendors-closing-2026 (3x). Cover how to get peptides through telemedicine, clinic options, what to expect, cost comparison, legitimacy checks. 2000+ words, 7th grade reading level.

title: Peptok: Write article — How to Read a Peptide COA (Certificate of Analysis)
description: Slug: how-to-read-peptide-coa. Referenced in complete-guide-to-peptides + peptide-vendors-closing-2026 (3x). Cover HPLC results, mass spec, purity %, what to look for, red flags, example COA walkthrough. 2000+ words, 7th grade reading level.

title: Peptok: Write article — 2026 Compounded Semaglutide Ban Explained
description: Slug: compounded-semaglutide-ban-2026. Referenced in complete-guide-to-peptides + peptide-vendors-closing-2026 (2x). Cover FDA ruling, impact on compounding pharmacies, patient alternatives, timeline, what it means for GLP-1 access. 2000+ words, 7th grade reading level.

title: Peptok: Create guide — Weight Loss Peptides
description: Route: /guides/weight-loss-peptides. Referenced in complete-guide-to-peptides. Comprehensive guide covering semaglutide, tirzepatide, AOD-9604, MOTS-c, tesamorelin. Mechanisms, comparisons, protocols, safety. 3000+ words, 7th grade reading level.

title: Peptok: Create guide — Recovery & Healing Peptides
description: Route: /guides/recovery-healing-peptides. Referenced in complete-guide-to-peptides. Cover BPC-157, TB-500, KPV, GHK-Cu, thymosin. Mechanisms, stacking, protocols. 3000+ words, 7th grade reading level.

title: Peptok: Create guide — Anti-Aging Peptides
description: Route: /guides/anti-aging-peptides. Referenced in complete-guide-to-peptides. Cover epithalon, GHK-Cu, SS-31, pinealon, vilon, cartalax. Telomere science, skin, longevity. 3000+ words, 7th grade reading level.

title: Peptok: Create guide — Performance Peptides
description: Route: /guides/performance-peptides. Referenced in complete-guide-to-peptides. Cover GHRPs, IGF-1 LR3, follistatin, AOD-9604, MK-677. Athletic performance, muscle, endurance. 3000+ words, 7th grade reading level.

title: Peptok: Create guide — Cognitive & Nootropic Peptides
description: Route: /guides/cognitive-peptides. Referenced in complete-guide-to-peptides. Cover selank, semax, dihexa, P21, noopept-adjacent peptides. Memory, focus, neuroprotection. 3000+ words, 7th grade reading level.

title: Peptok: Create guide — Peptide Safety & Sourcing
description: Route: /guides/peptide-safety-sourcing. Referenced in complete-guide-to-peptides. Cover how to buy safely, COA verification, vendor red flags, reconstitution, storage, injection safety. 3000+ words, 7th grade reading level.

title: Peptok: Fix /peptides/ links to /peptide/ in article content
description: Articles link to /peptides/bpc-157, /peptides/semaglutide, /peptides/tb-500 but the actual route is /peptide/[id] (singular). Update content in Supabase DB. Also need to create /guides/ route to support guide pages.

title: Peptok: Create /guides route and listing page
description: No /guides/ route exists. Need app/guides/page.tsx (listing) and app/guides/[slug]/page.tsx (detail). Can reuse article pattern — guides are just long-form articles in a different category. Consider storing in articles table with a type/category field, or create guides table.

title: EPIC: Forge Phase 2 — Product Experience & UI
description: Full UX buildout for Forge. Three core screens (Floor, Board, Briefing) + auth, real-time, mobile, integrations. See memory/projects/forge-ux-vision.md for full spec.

title: Forge: Authentication & user accounts (Supabase Auth or Clerk)
description: Login/signup, session management, multi-seat support. Evaluate Supabase Auth vs Clerk. Need: email/password, OAuth (Google/GitHub), invite system for co-founders/employees, permission levels (admin/approver/viewer).

title: Forge: Build 'The Floor' — main home screen with expert cards + activity stream
description: Home screen. Left rail: expert avatars with status dots (working/waiting/blocked/idle). Center: real-time activity stream. Right rail: action queue (things needing human attention). Business selector in top bar. Chat-first: click expert → conversation.

title: Forge: WebSocket/SSE real-time activity feed
description: Real-time updates for the Floor and Board. Expert cards pulse when working. Activity stream updates live. Typing indicators. Use SSE or WebSocket from forge-core API.

title: Forge: Build 'The Board' — kanban task view (Queued → Working → Needs You → Done)
description: Kanban board. Columns: Queued, Working, Needs You (RED), Done. Cards show task title, expert avatar, priority heat, time in column. Click → see work + one-click approve/reject. Filter by expert/business/priority. Drag to reassign. Integrates with Beads.

title: Forge: Build 'The Briefing' — intelligence/summary view
description: Weekly/daily rollup screen. Auto-generated summary of team accomplishments. Decisions log (approved/pending/expired). Cross-business insights. Revenue dashboard if Shopify/Stripe connected. Exportable via email.

title: Forge: Expert profile page — personality, history, stats, autonomy
description: Click any expert → full profile. Shows personality traits, work history, memory highlights, performance stats, autonomy level slider, model assignment. Feels like an employee profile not a config page.

title: Forge: Autonomy slider — per-expert trust/freedom level
description: Per-expert setting: full approval required ← → fully autonomous. Controls what actions need human approval. Users start conservative, increase as trust builds. The emotional arc of the product.

title: Forge: Mobile approval UX — push notifications + swipe approve
description: Push notification with context preview. Expand → see the action details → swipe to approve/reject. Simple yes/no should never require opening the app. Run your business from the hockey rink.

title: Forge: Cost visibility — per-task, per-expert, monthly burn rate
description: Every task shows estimated/actual token cost. Per-expert burn rate on their card. Monthly team cost summary. ROI framing: cost vs estimated hours saved. Never hide the cost.

title: Forge: The Forge Moment — expert creation animation + onboarding flow
description: New expert creation = fire/anvil animation. Personality traits appear one by one. Expert speaks first words. Full onboarding: 1) Name your business, 2) Meet your team (auto-generated), 3) First task, 4) Watch them work, 5) First approval. Brand-defining screenshot moment.

title: Forge: Playbooks — pre-built task templates across experts
description: Pre-built templates: Launch Product, Monthly Financial Review, Content Calendar Sprint, Competitive Analysis. One click → auto-creates tasks across multiple experts → cascade engine kicks off. How you scale from 1 to 5 businesses.

title: Forge: Integration Hub — visual connected services page
description: Visual page showing connected services (Shopify ✅, Gmail ✅, Notion ⬜). Each integration unlocks capabilities for relevant experts. Connect Shopify → Marcus tracks revenue. Connect Gmail → Sofia sends campaigns.

title: Forge: Weekly Scorecard Email — auto-generated team report
description: Auto-generated Monday email. Branded, shareable. What your team did last week, decisions made, metrics moved. Shareable with investors/partners. The proof-it-works artifact. SendGrid or Resend.

title: Forge: Multi-seat access — co-founders, employees, permission levels
description: Invite system for co-founders/VAs/employees. Permission levels: admin (full), approver (approve decisions), viewer (read-only), expert-scoped (only certain experts). Important for Kevin+Scott on Adaptaphoria.

title: EPIC: Forge Kits — Plugin SDK & Marketplace
description: The extensibility layer that makes Forge a platform. Kits = Expert Template + Tools + Playbooks + Integrations bundled together. MCP-compatible under the hood. Kit Store marketplace with revenue share. See memory/projects/forge-ux-vision.md.

title: Forge: Kit manifest spec (forge-kit.yaml schema)
description: Define the forge-kit.yaml format. Sections: meta (name/desc/price), experts (personality/model/autonomy/tools), tools (MCP server refs + auth), playbooks (multi-step workflows), triggers (webhooks/schedules/events). Version it from day one.

title: Forge: MCP tool adapter layer — run MCP servers as expert tools
description: Bridge between Forge experts and MCP servers. Expert calls a tool → Forge routes to the MCP server → returns result. Handle auth (OAuth2, API keys), rate limiting, error handling. Every tool in a Kit is an MCP server under the hood.

title: Forge: Kit installer — one-click install with OAuth flows
description: Install a Kit: parse manifest, create expert instances from templates, connect MCP tool servers, register playbooks, set up triggers. OAuth flow for each integration (Shopify, Gmail, etc). Rollback on failure.

title: Forge: Kit CLI — init, add-expert, add-tool, test, publish
description: Developer CLI: forge kit init (scaffold), add-expert (template wizard), add-tool (add MCP server ref), test (local sandbox), publish (push to Kit Store). Validate manifest, run checks, upload.

title: Forge: Kit Store UI — browse, search, install kits
description: App Store for Forge Kits. Browse by category (E-Commerce, Content, Agency, SaaS, Real Estate). Search, ratings, reviews, install counts. One-click install with OAuth. Featured/trending kits. Free vs premium badges.

title: Forge: Playbook engine — multi-step workflows across experts
description: Playbooks are pre-built task sequences that span multiple experts. 'Launch Sale' = create-discount → draft-emails → schedule-social → monitor-revenue. Playbooks auto-create tasks, assign to experts, and use cascade engine for approval. Kits include playbooks.

title: Forge: Trigger system — webhooks, schedules, events → auto-run playbooks
description: Event-driven triggers that auto-start playbooks or notify experts. Types: webhook (shopify.order.created), schedule (cron), internal events (task.completed, expert.blocked). Configured in Kit manifest or manually per business.

title: Forge: Build first-party Shopify Kit
description: First official Kit. Includes: Marketing Pro, Finance Analyst, Inventory Manager experts. Tools: Shopify MCP (orders, products, discounts, analytics), email, social scheduler. Playbooks: Launch Sale, Monthly P&L, Restock Alert, Weekly Report. This is the reference implementation.

title: Forge: Build first-party Content Studio Kit
description: Second official Kit. Includes: Content Strategist, SEO Specialist experts. Tools: WordPress MCP, Google Search Console, analytics. Playbooks: Publish Article, Monthly SEO Audit, Content Calendar. Good for Peptok/Pronoia use case.

title: Forge: Kit marketplace billing — Stripe integration, revenue share
description: Stripe Connect for Kit marketplace. Free kits, premium kits ($5-50/mo), custom kits. 70/30 revenue share. Subscription management, usage tracking, creator payouts. This is the business model that makes Forge a platform.

title: Forge: Kit developer portal — docs, examples, submission review
description: Developer-facing site: Kit SDK docs, API reference, example kits (with source), submission guidelines, review process. Think Shopify Partner Portal. Attract developers to build on Forge.

title: Forge: Build Social Media Kit — multi-platform content, scheduling, analytics
description:
The Social Media Kit. Experts: Social Media Manager, Content Creator, Community Manager. 

Platforms covered:
- Instagram (posts, reels, stories, carousel)
- LinkedIn (articles, posts, company page)
- X/Twitter (threads, posts, engagement)
- Reddit (posts, comments, subreddit monitoring)
- YouTube (video descriptions, community posts, comment management)
- TikTok (captions, hashtag strategy, trend monitoring)
- Facebook (posts, ads manager basics)

Tools (MCP servers):
- @forge/mcp-instagram (Meta Graph API)
- @forge/mcp-linkedin (LinkedIn API)
- @forge/mcp-twitter (X API v2)
- @forge/mcp-reddit (Reddit API)
- @forge/mcp-youtube (YouTube Data API)
- @forge/mcp-tiktok (TikTok API)
- @forge/mcp-buffer or @forge/mcp-hootsuite (cross-platform scheduling)

Playbooks:
- 'Weekly Content Calendar' — plan + draft + schedule across all platforms
- 'Product Launch Blitz' — coordinated multi-platform campaign
- 'Engagement Sweep' — reply to comments, DMs, mentions across platforms
- 'Trend Newsjack' — monitor trends, draft reactive content, get approval, post
- 'Monthly Analytics Report' — pull metrics from all platforms, generate insights
- 'Reddit AMA Prep' — prepare talking points, monitor thread, draft responses
- 'YouTube Upload Pipeline' — generate title/desc/tags/thumbnail prompt, schedule

Key features:
- Content calendar view (visual grid of scheduled posts)
- Platform-specific formatting (aspect ratios, character limits, hashtag strategies)
- A/B testing suggestions
- Best time to post per platform
- Repurpose engine: one piece of content → adapted for each platform
- Approval flow: draft → preview mockup → approve → auto-post

title: Forge: MCP server — Instagram/Meta Graph API
description: MCP server for Instagram via Meta Graph API. Capabilities: publish posts/reels/stories/carousels, read insights/analytics, manage comments, read DMs, schedule content. OAuth2 auth with Meta Business Suite.

title: Forge: MCP server — LinkedIn API
description: MCP server for LinkedIn. Capabilities: publish posts/articles, manage company page, read analytics, engage with comments, share to groups. OAuth2 auth.

title: Forge: MCP server — X/Twitter API v2
description: MCP server for X/Twitter API v2. Capabilities: post tweets/threads, read timeline/mentions, manage lists, read analytics, engage (like/retweet/reply). OAuth2 auth.

title: Forge: MCP server — Reddit API
description: MCP server for Reddit. Capabilities: post to subreddits, read/reply to comments, monitor subreddits for keywords, read analytics (upvotes, engagement), manage AMAs. OAuth2 auth.

title: Forge: MCP server — YouTube Data API
description: MCP server for YouTube Data API. Capabilities: upload/manage videos, update titles/descriptions/tags, read analytics (views, subs, watch time), manage comments, community posts, playlists. OAuth2 auth.

title: Forge: MCP server — TikTok API
description: MCP server for TikTok. Capabilities: publish videos (via TikTok Creator Tools API), read analytics, trend monitoring, hashtag research, comment management. OAuth2 auth.

title: Forge: Cross-platform content repurpose engine
description: One piece of content → adapted for every platform automatically. Blog post → LinkedIn article + Twitter thread + Instagram carousel + Reddit post + YouTube community post. Each version respects platform norms (length, tone, hashtags, formatting). Expert reviews before posting.

title: Forge: Content calendar UI — visual scheduling across platforms
description: Visual calendar grid showing scheduled content across all platforms. Color-coded by platform. Click to preview mockup (how it'll look on Instagram vs LinkedIn). Drag to reschedule. Gap detection: 'You have nothing scheduled for Thursday.' Best-time-to-post suggestions per platform.

title: Forge: Real Estate Kit — listings, leads, CRM, market analysis
description: Experts: Listing Agent, Market Analyst, Lead Manager. Tools: Zillow/Realtor API, MLS data, CRM (HubSpot/Follow Up Boss), email/SMS. Playbooks: New Listing Launch (photos→description→MLS→social→open house), Lead Nurture Sequence, Market Report (monthly comps + trends), Offer Analysis (compare multiple offers side by side). High-value niche — agents pay for tools.

title: Forge: SaaS Founder Kit — metrics, churn, support, growth
description: Experts: Growth Analyst, Customer Success Manager, Product Strategist. Tools: Stripe MCP (MRR, churn, LTV), Intercom/Zendesk (support tickets), PostHog/Mixpanel (product analytics), GitHub (issue tracking). Playbooks: Monthly SaaS Metrics Report, Churn Risk Alert (identify at-risk users), Feature Request Triage, Pricing Experiment Analysis, Investor Update Draft.

title: Forge: Legal & Compliance Kit — contracts, policy, regulatory tracking
description: Experts: Legal Analyst, Compliance Officer. Tools: document parser, regulatory feed APIs, contract template engine. Playbooks: Contract Review (flag risky clauses, suggest edits), Policy Update Alert (track FDA/FTC/state law changes), Terms of Service Generator, GDPR/CCPA Audit Checklist, Vendor Agreement Review. High value for regulated industries (Adaptaphoria, peptides).

title: Forge: Restaurant & Food Biz Kit — menu, ordering, inventory, reviews
description: Experts: Operations Manager, Marketing Specialist, Menu Analyst. Tools: Square/Toast POS, Yelp/Google Reviews API, DoorDash/UberEats, inventory management. Playbooks: Menu Price Optimization (food cost analysis), Review Response (auto-draft replies to Yelp/Google), Weekly Inventory Order, Social Media Food Photography Schedule, Seasonal Menu Launch.

title: Forge: Fitness & Coaching Kit — clients, programming, nutrition, scheduling
description: Experts: Program Designer, Nutrition Coach, Client Manager. Tools: Trainerize/TrueCoach API, MyFitnessPal, calendar/scheduling, payment (Stripe). Playbooks: New Client Onboarding (intake form→assessment→first program), Weekly Check-In Generator, Nutrition Plan Builder, Progress Report (measurements + photos + metrics), Re-engagement (inactive clients).

title: Forge: Crypto & DeFi Kit — portfolio tracking, alerts, research
description: Experts: Portfolio Analyst, DeFi Researcher, Risk Manager. Tools: CoinGecko/CoinMarketCap API, DEX APIs (Uniswap, Jupiter), wallet trackers (Etherscan, Solscan), news feeds. Playbooks: Daily Portfolio Briefing, Whale Alert Monitor, New Token Research Report, Tax Lot Tracking (for CPA), Yield Farm Comparison, Risk Exposure Analysis.

title: Forge: HR & Recruiting Kit — hiring pipeline, onboarding, culture
description: Experts: Recruiter, HR Manager, Culture Coordinator. Tools: LinkedIn Recruiter, Greenhouse/Lever ATS, BambooHR, calendar, email. Playbooks: Job Description Generator, Candidate Screen (resume→scorecard), Interview Prep Kit (questions per role), Offer Letter Draft, 30-60-90 Onboarding Plan, Employee Pulse Survey Analysis, PTO/Benefits FAQ Bot.

title: Forge: Podcast & Media Kit — production, show notes, distribution, guests
description: Experts: Producer, Show Notes Writer, Guest Booker. Tools: Riverside/Descript API, Spotify for Podcasters, Apple Podcasts Connect, YouTube, email outreach, calendar. Playbooks: Episode Production Pipeline (record→edit notes→publish→distribute→promote), Guest Research & Outreach, Show Notes + Timestamps Generator, Audiogram Clip Creator (pull quotes), Sponsorship Pitch Deck.

title: Forge: Local Service Biz Kit — plumber, electrician, contractor ops
description: Experts: Dispatch Manager, Estimator, Reputation Manager. Tools: Jobber/Housecall Pro API, Google Business Profile, QuickBooks, SMS/calling. Playbooks: Lead Response (instant quote estimate), Job Scheduling Optimizer, Invoice & Follow-up, Review Request (after job completion), Google Business Post Weekly, Seasonal Service Campaign (HVAC spring check, etc).

title: Forge: Education & Course Creator Kit — curriculum, students, marketing
description: Experts: Curriculum Designer, Student Success Manager, Launch Strategist. Tools: Teachable/Kajabi/Thinkific API, email (ConvertKit), Stripe, community platform (Circle/Discord). Playbooks: Course Outline Generator, Lesson Content Drafter, Student Progress Check-in, Launch Sequence (waitlist→cart open→urgency→close), Testimonial Collector, Upsell/Cross-sell Engine.

title: Forge: 60-Second Onboarding — URL flow (scrape → forge team → first task → watch it happen)
description:
The wow-moment onboarding for users WITH a website/URL.

FLOW (60 seconds total):
1. 'What's your business?' — name + URL only (10s)
2. 'We found your business' — show scraped logo, industry, products, tone (5s). Background: scrape site, extract brand voice, products, social links.
3. THE FORGE MOMENT — dark screen, embers, anvil. 3-5 experts appear one by one with personalized intros referencing the actual business. 'Meet Sofia. She already noticed your Instagram hasn't posted in 2 weeks.' (15s)
4. 'Give them something to do' — pre-populated task suggestions based on scrape: 'Draft 5 Instagram posts', 'Write competitor analysis', 'Review website copy'. One tap. (15s)
5. WATCH IT HAPPEN — Floor appears, expert goes green, activity stream fills in real-time with actual work about THEIR business. (15s)

SECOND WOW: A second expert proactively chimes in with an unsolicited insight about their business.

PRINCIPLES: Value before login. Work before payment. Magic before explanation. No config, no tutorials, no empty states.

Technical: web scraper service (Firecrawl or custom), brand extraction AI pipeline, expert template personalization, real-time activity rendering.

title: Forge: No-URL Onboarding — conversational flow for businesses without a website
description:
The wow-moment onboarding for users WITHOUT a website/URL.

FLOW (90 seconds total):
1. 'What's your business?' — name field + URL field. URL is optional. If blank, show 'No website yet? No problem.'
2. QUICK INTERVIEW (chat-style, not a form) — 3-4 rapid questions:
   - 'What do you do?' (free text: 'I sell handmade candles on Etsy')
   - 'Who are your customers?' (free text or pick: 'Direct consumers / Other businesses / Both')
   - 'What's your biggest headache right now?' (picks: Marketing, Sales, Operations, Finance, Content, Hiring, 'I don't know yet')
   - 'How big is your team?' (Just me / 2-5 / 5-20 / 20+)
   Each answer animates away smoothly. Feels like texting, not filling out a form.
3. 'Got it. Let me build your team.' — THE FORGE MOMENT (same fire/anvil animation)
   Experts are tailored to their answers. Candle seller gets: Social Media Expert (Etsy + Instagram focus), Product Photographer AI, Financial Tracker.
   Headache answer drives which expert speaks first.
4. FIRST TASK — suggestions based on their answers:
   - If headache=Marketing: 'Draft your first Instagram campaign'
   - If headache=Finance: 'Estimate your monthly costs and margins'
   - If headache='I don't know': 'Let me audit your business and tell you where to focus'
   The 'I don't know' path is GOLD — expert comes back with a real analysis.
5. WATCH IT HAPPEN — same as URL flow.

KEY INSIGHT: The no-URL flow should feel BETTER than a form, not worse. It's a conversation with an AI that's about to become your team. The chat IS the onboarding.

Also works for: pre-launch startups, side hustles, freelancers, people exploring the product.

title: Forge: Web scraper service — extract brand, products, voice from URL
description: Service that takes a URL and extracts: business name, logo, industry, products/services, brand voice/tone, color palette, social media links, recent blog posts, team members. Used in onboarding to personalize expert intros and first task suggestions. Options: Firecrawl API, Jina Reader, or custom Playwright scraper. Output: structured JSON brand profile. Cache results.

title: Forge: Expert personalization engine — tailor experts to the specific business
description: Takes brand profile (from scraper or interview) and personalizes each expert's intro, knowledge base, and first actions. Sofia doesn't just say 'I do marketing' — she says 'I noticed your Etsy shop has 47 reviews but no Instagram presence. I can fix that.' Experts feel like they already did research on your business before they met you. Uses LLM to generate personalized intros + first task suggestions based on brand context.

title: Forge: Weekly Scorecard shareable image — 'My AI team saved me X hours'
description: Auto-generated branded image card every week: tasks completed, hours saved, money saved, team cost. One-click share to LinkedIn/Twitter/Instagram stories. 'My AI team costs $38/mo and saved me 34 hours' is LinkedIn catnip. Include Forge branding + tryforge.ai CTA. Generate as PNG/OG image.

title: Forge: Expert Quote cards — shareable AI team insights
description: When an expert produces a great insight, generate a shareable card: quote + expert name + role + 'Powered by Forge'. Looks like a real team Slack message. One-click share. People share because it makes them look like they have a sophisticated operation. Auto-detect share-worthy moments from expert output.

title: Forge: Make Forge Moment screen-recordable — cinematic expert creation
description: The expert creation animation should be cinematic enough that people WANT to screen-record and post to TikTok/Reels/Stories. Fire, anvil, embers. Experts materialize with personality. Sound design matters. This is organic social content that costs us nothing.

title: Forge: Invite co-founder flow — network effect referral
description: After onboarding: 'Your team is working. Want Scott to see this too?' One-click invite. Co-founder gets personalized Floor view, sees team working, thinks 'I need this for MY business.' Built-in referral: 'Kevin invited you to Forge.' Every multi-person business = 2-5 potential users from one signup.

title: Forge: Public Boards — opt-in transparent task boards with CTA
description: Let businesses make their Board public. Startups use for investor transparency, agencies show clients work is happening, influencers show behind-the-scenes. Each public board has 'Get your own AI team' CTA. Shareable URL: forge.ai/team/adaptaphoria. SEO value + social proof + acquisition channel.

title: Forge: Free Business Audit — paste URL, get AI team recommendation report
description: Free, no-signup acquisition tool. User pastes URL → we scrape → generate report: 'You're leaving ~$4k/mo on the table. Here's what Sofia, Marcus, and Patricia would do in their first week.' The report IS the funnel. Shareable, emailable, screenshottable. CTA: 'Hire this team → one click.' Can be a standalone landing page at tryforge.ai/audit. Uses the same scraper from onboarding.

title: Forge: Expert-generated content for user's social — ghostwritten posts
description: Experts generate content about the user's INDUSTRY (not just their business). 'Sofia wrote a LinkedIn post about Etsy seller trends — publish under your name?' User gets free content → posts → gets engagement → attributes to Forge in comments. Forge-powered content appears organically across social. Opt-in. Per-platform formatting.

title: Forge: Community leaderboard — top teams, most hours saved, spotlights
description: Gamification: 'Top Forge Teams This Week' — most tasks completed, most hours saved, best ROI. Monthly spotlight: 'How [Business] used Forge to 3x their output.' Case studies write themselves from real usage data. Leaderboard page + social sharing. Opt-in only.

title: Forge: Kit creators as growth channel — marketplace developers bring audiences
description: Every Kit developer who publishes to the marketplace brings their OWN audience. Fitness influencer builds Fitness Coach Kit → promotes to 200k followers. SaaS blogger builds SaaS Metrics Kit → writes about it. Kit creator affiliate program with revenue share. Developer spotlight blog. Each Kit creator = a growth channel. Shopify app store model.

title: Forge: Referral loop — month free both sides + expert personalized welcome
description: 'Your team saved 34 hours this month. Know someone drowning in work?' Give month free to both sides. The REAL hook: referral's expert says 'Kevin's team sent us. Let's get to work.' Triggered at high-satisfaction moments (big task completion, good scorecard week). Track referral chain. Cap free months to prevent abuse.

title: Forge: Pricing model — Free/Pro/Team/Agency tiers
description: Free: 1 biz, 3 experts, 50 tasks/mo. Pro ($49): 3 biz, unlimited experts+tasks, all Kits. Team ($99): multi-seat, 10 biz, custom experts, API. Agency ($249): white-label, client mgmt, custom Kits. Upgrade trigger is desire (more experts, second business) not frustration. Stripe integration.

title: Forge: Inter-expert collaboration — agents that talk to each other
description: THE differentiator. Sofia finds marketing opportunity → tells Marcus to run numbers → Marcus approves budget → tells Patricia to draft vendor contract → Patricia sends for human approval. User sees the final ask, team self-organized. Visible in activity stream as a conversation chain. This is what nobody else has.

title: Forge: Expert memory — persistent context that grows over time (switching cost)
description: Experts learn your business over time. Sofia after 6 months knows brand voice, competitors, seasonal patterns. pgvector semantic memory per expert per business. Memory powers better work + creates switching cost. Show memory highlights on expert profile page. 'Sofia has 847 memories about your business.'

title: Forge: Smart model routing — cheap models for routine, expensive for complex
description: Cost management. Route simple tasks (status updates, formatting) to fast/cheap models (Gemini Flash, Haiku). Route complex tasks (strategy, analysis, writing) to powerful models (Opus, Sonnet). Per-expert model assignment with smart auto-routing. Show cost savings: 'Smart routing saved you $23 this month.'

title: Forge: Domain + brand identity — lock name, domain, handles, visual identity
description: Lock down: domain (tryforge.ai? forge.ai? forgeai.com?), Twitter/X handle, GitHub org, logo, color palette, brand guidelines. Need before any public launch or landing page. Kevin to decide on final name.

title: Forge: Subdomain tenant routing (*.forge.app)
Forge: Stripe billing integration — checkout, subscriptions, usage metering
description: Integrate Stripe for payment processing. Checkout flow for Free→Pro→Team→Agency tiers, subscription management, usage-based metering for premium model surcharges, webhook handlers for payment events. Required for launch — can't charge without it.
